column4: if it goes on like this "uh no you have to install restricted-bad-ugly-hitler packages" I'm in the mood to make a "ubuntu-pirate-nazi-communist" edition...
It really sucks to have 32894723947 additional "bad" things installed to make ubuntu usable for multimedia
the university which i'm going to invented mp3 and everybody here in germany uses lame encoder without copyright issues
lame is already installed, but the sound-recorder doesn'T offer me to create .mp3s
Save as wave, open in audacity and export as mp3 (you'll have to tell audacity where lame is in the prefrences first).
I tried this but the encoding scrambles the file up, a 10sec recording has a length of 7834min
What bitrate did you record it at?
i used the default settings, no idea
Could you send it to me (/dcc send /path/to/file)?
eh one sec, i already deleted the recording and my brother theft my headset, but this afternoon i'll have it back
are you regularly here in this channel?
Yes, but I suggest recording it in audacity in the first place.
alright, thank you. I'll come back to you, ok?
